definition: start explaining and it's a long story (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
length/long/forever/always/constantly

sentences.english: Mine is a long and sad tale.
sentences.chinese: 我的事說來話長，並且令人因感想而悲傷。

sentences.english: It's a long story. Let's just see how Wolpe did that.
sentences.chinese: 說來話長，還是讓我們看看沃爾帕是怎麼開始的吧。
氪星的大惡棍，說來話長。

sentences.english: "I've a further report to make, " I said, "and a pretty long one.
sentences.chinese: “還有一事稟報，”我說，“這可就說來話長了。

sentences.english: It’s a long story, but put it in a nutshell, he got killed by another bad guy.
sentences.chinese: 說來話長，不過長話短說，他被另一個壞蛋幹掉了。

sentences.english: How Ms Maitland gets to that point is a long story;
sentences.chinese: 曼特蘭如何走到這裏也是說來話長。

sentences.english: It's a long story. The long and the short of it is I'm in love with Annie.
sentences.chinese: 說來話長，整個故事是因爲我正和安妮談戀愛。

sentences.english: How I got here is a long story.
sentences.chinese: 我是怎麼來到這裏的說來話長。
它保護着我說來話長了。

definition: way/method/means/Taiwan pr. [fa1 r5]
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
confused/vague/indistinct/muddle-headed/mixed up/in a daze
arranged betrothal of minors
to get straight to the point (idiom)
conventional greeting/polite formula
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
pretty close/very near/about right
reckless/extremely daring
to agree on/to settle on
to stop at this point/to end here/to call it a day
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
